p: At Seer, we are passionate about empowering our customers to expand scientific discoveries and achieve exceptional scientific outcomes. Our team is growing quickly as we develop innovative approaches to solve complex biological questions. And we believe the next frontier in biology is enabled through a clearer and more complete view of the proteome =E2=80=93 something that Seer can uniquely deliver. As we build our team, we are looking for collaborative, driven, intellectually curious people who are committed to solving complex challenges. Our culture rewards accountability and cross functional teamwork, because we believe that this enables the kind of breakthrough thinking that will accelerate our mission.
p.4: Reporting to the Director of Data Science, we are seeking an exceptional Bioinformatics Data Scientist to join our Data Science team based in our Redwood City office. This group implements and develops the newest methods for proteomics molecular profiling leveraging Seer=E2=80=99s proprietary technology platform and the latest generation of mass spectrometers. The driving focus of this team, working closely with the Assay and Mass Spectrometry groups, is to extract value and insights from large scale datasets produced by Seer-technology.
p.6: Seer=E2=80=99s new Data Scientist will be empowered to perform exploratory data analysis, data wrangling, statistical analysis, and design machine learning models. The ideal candidate will have a track record of accomplishments applying data science methods to address biological problems in academia or in the life sciences/pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry. Significant experience with LCMS proteomics data is highly desired.
p.8: The successful candidate is likely to have a background in computer science, bioinformatics, molecular biology, or biochemistry with 3 years experience in life science data engineering. This role requires superior skills in programs including Python or R, as well as a highly collaborative work ethic.
p.12: The Data Science group is focused on using modern data science tooling for processing and analyzing our proteomics molecular profiling data. Areas of specific responsibility and attention will include:

li: Perform exploratory data analysis, data wrangling, statistical analysis and design/train/test machine learning models. Use appropriate and succinct methods, reproducible reporting, and visualizations to convey insights to the wider team
li.1: The analysis, selection & iteration of Seer=E2=80=99s computational proteomic data processing pipeline =E2=80=93 maximizing the identification and quantification of the features present in the raw mass spectrometry data
li.2: Partner with data engineers to ensure all optimizations can scale
li.3: Carefully curate generated data sets, optimizing for traceability and ease of access
li.4: Stay current with developments in data science and internally promote new techniques/ideas
li.5: Interact with company leadership to develop Seer=E2=80=99s data science strategy
li.6: Work closely with the Assay and Mass Spectrometry groups, as well as interact, collaborate, and support other functional teams within the broader Seer Research, Development, and Clinical framework

p.16: The successful candidate for the position of Data Scientist must have a demonstrated record of accomplishments in academia or the life sciences industry. The ideal candidate will have had significant experience in analyzing proteomic or genomic data. Candidates must bring a strong entrepreneurial orientation along with teamwork skills and an absolute commitment to competing with the highest level of integrity.

li: Bachelor of Science (or equivalent) in relevant discipline such as computer science, bioinformatics, molecular biology or biochemistry. Further graduate degree preferred.
li.1: Minimum 3 years=E2=80=99 experience (4+ preferred) in an academic or life-sciences industry laboratory setting (biotech start-up experience preferred)
li.2: Superior Python or R skills in data analysis, statistics and machine learning. Comfortable in Jupyter/RStudio environments (experience in Domino Data Lab an advantage)
li.3: Strong understanding of reproducible data analysis methods and best practices in software development.
li.4: Familiarity of relational databases and good working knowledge of SQL
li.5: Knowledge of Skyline, OpenMS, MaxQuant and other proteomic computational tools would be a distinct advantage
li.6: Strong written and oral communication skills, with demonstrated experience in cross-functional and timely communication
li.7: Strong and collaborative work ethic; must be a self-starter and persistent in achieving objectives to support Seer=E2=80=99s scientific and business goals
li.8: Must work well in a small team setting, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively, while meeting scheduled deadlines in a fast-paced environment
